inputs.name: actions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Space delimited list of actions.  Valid options are build, clean, test, analyze, and archive.  For example: `build clean` would do a clean build.  See [xcodebuild man page](https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Darwin/Reference/ManPages/man1/xcodebuild.1.html)
inputs.label: Actions

inputs.name: sdk
inputs.helpMarkDown: Build an Xcode project or workspace against the specified SDK.  Run *xcodebuild -showsdks* to see the valid list of SDKs.
inputs.label: SDK

inputs.name: xcWorkspacePath
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional relative path from repo root to the Xcode workspace or project. For example: `MyApp/MyApp.xcworkspace` or `MyApp/MyApp.xcworkspace/MyApp.xcodeproj`. Leave blank if you intend to use the -target flag under Advanced Arguments.
inputs.label: Workspace/Project Path

inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional scheme name in Xcode. *Must be a shared scheme* (shared checkbox under managed schemes in Xcode). **Required if Workspace is specified.**
inputs.label: Scheme
inputs.name: scheme
packageApp
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether an IPA should be generated as a part of the build. For exporting archives with Xcode 7 and Xcode 8, review additional inputs in the `Package Options` section.
inputs.label: Create App Package

inputs.name: archivePath
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally specify a directory where created archives should be placed.
inputs.label: Archive Path

inputs.name: exportPath
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally specify the destination for the product exported from the archive.
inputs.label: Export Path

inputs.name: exportOptions
inputs.label: Export Options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Pick a way to pass in Export Options when exporting the archive.

inputs.name: exportMethod
inputs.label: Export Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Method for how Xcode should export the archive. E.g. app-store, package, ad-hoc, enterprise, development.

inputs.name: exportTeamId
inputs.label: Team ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: The 10 digit Team ID from the Apple Developer Portal to use for this export.

inputs.name: exportOptionsPlist
inputs.label: Export Options Plist
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to a plist file that configures archive exporting.

inputs.name: exportArgs
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional command line arguments that should be used to export.
inputs.label: Export Arguments

inputs.name: xcode8AutomaticSigning
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this if you have an Xcode 8 or Xcode 9 project configured for Automatic Signing.
inputs.label: Automatic Signing

inputs.name: teamId
inputs.label: Team ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the 10 digit developer Team ID. This is required if you are a member of multiple development teams.

inputs.name: signMethod
inputs.label: Override Using
inputs.helpMarkDown: If the build should use a signing or provisioning method that is different than the default, choose that method here. Choose 'File Contents' to use a P12 certificate and provisioning profile. Choose 'Identifiers' to retrieve signing settings from the default Keychain and pre-installed profiles. Leave the corresponding fields blank if you do not wish to override default build settings.

inputs.name: iosSigningIdentity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional signing identity override that should be used to sign the build. Defaults to Xcode Project setting. You may need to select Unlock Default Keychain if you use this option.
inputs.label: Signing Identity

inputs.name: unlockDefaultKeychain
inputs.label: Unlock Default Keychain
inputs.helpMarkDown: Resolve "User interaction is not allowed" errors by unlocking the default keychain.

inputs.name: defaultKeychainPassword
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password to unlock the default keychain when this option is set.
inputs.label: Default Keychain Password

inputs.name: provProfileUuid
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional UUID of an installed provisioning profile to be used for this build. Use separate build tasks with different Schemes or Targets to specify separate provisioning profiles by target in a single workspace (iOS, WatchKit, tvOS).
inputs.label: Provisioning Profile UUID

inputs.name: p12
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional relative path to a PKCS12 formatted p12 certificate file containing a signing certificate to be used for this build.
inputs.label: P12 Certificate File

inputs.name: p12pwd
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password to P12 Certificate File if specified. Use a Build Variable to encrypt.
inputs.label: P12 Password

inputs.name: provProfile
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional relative path to file containing provisioning profile override to be used for this build. Use separate build tasks with different Schemes or Targets to specify separate provisioning profiles by target in a single workspace (iOS, WatchKit, tvOS).
inputs.label: Provisioning Profile File

inputs.name: removeProfile
inputs.label: Remove Profile After Build
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies that the contents of the Provisioning Profile File should be removed from the build agent after the build is complete. **Only check if you are running one agent per user.**

inputs.name: args
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional command line arguments that should be used to build. Useful if you want to use -target or -project instead of specifying a Workspace and Scheme.
inputs.label: Arguments

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory for build runs. Defaults to the root of the repository.
inputs.label: Working Directory

inputs.name: outputPattern
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path where build output (binaries) will be placed.
inputs.label: Output Directory

inputs.name: xcodeDeveloperDir
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional path to Xcode Developer folder if not the system default. For use when multiple versions of Xcode are installed on a system. Ex: /Applications/Xcode 7.app/Contents/Developer
inputs.label: Xcode Developer Path

inputs.name: useXcpretty
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use xcpretty to format xcodebuild output and generate JUnit test results report. Requires xcpretty be installed on agent hosts. See [xcpretty](https://github.com/supermarin/xcpretty) for details.
inputs.label: Use xcpretty

inputs.name: publishJUnitResults
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to publish JUnit Test results to VSTS/TFS.
inputs.label: Publish to VSTS/TFS

name: Xcode-sxs
author: Microsoft Corporation
description: Build an Xcode workspace on macOS

messages.WorkspaceOrProjectRequiredForArchive: Workspace or Project path needs to be specified to generate the package with xcodebuild archive and export.
messages.TempKeychainDeleteFailed: Failed to delete temporary keychain %s created during the build.
messages.ProvProfileDetailsNotFound: Failed to find the details for provisioning profile: %s
messages.NoTestResultsFound: No test result files matching %s were found, so publishing JUnit test results is being skipped.
messages.SchemeRequiredForArchive: Scheme needs to be specified to generate the package with xcodebuild archive and export.
messages.SignIdNotFound: Failed to find iOS signing identity. Verify the signing and provisioning information provided.
messages.FailedToGenerateExportOptionsPlist: Failed to automatically generate an Export Options Plist to export an IPA. Please specify an Export Options Plist in the Package Options.
messages.ProvProfileUUIDNotFound: Failed to find provisioning profile UUID for provisioning profile: %s
messages.ExportOptionsPlistInvalidFilePath: Export Options Plist file does not exist at %s. Provide the path to a valid Plist file.
messages.ExportMethodNotIdentified: Failed to identify the export method to use automatically from the archive file. This might cause errors during build or produce an invalid package. Set `Export Options` to `Specify` or `Plist`.
messages.WorkspaceDoesNotExist: Xcode workspace was specified but it does not exist or is not a directory: %s
messages.TempKeychainSetupFailed: Failed to add the temporary keychain to the keychains search path.
messages.ProvProfileDeleteFailed: Failed to delete the provisioning profile %s.
messages.MultipleWorkspacesFound: Multiple xcode workspace matches were found. Using the first match: %s
messages.UseXcprettyForTestPublishing: When using xcodebuild, check 'Use xcpretty' to publish test results. No results will be published.
messages.XcodeSuccess: Xcode task execution completed with no errors.
